answerText: Roman Colosseum or Coliseum [or Flavian Amphitheatre or Amphitheatrum Flavianum; or Anfiteatro Flavio or Colosseo][10] A so-called "square" version of the Colosseum can be found in this business district of Rome that was developed according to Fascist ideals. It also contains the Museum of Roman Civilization.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 8 | 8 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: Answer the following about some architectural sites of the city of Rome. For 10 points each: [10] This building lies directly east of the Temple of Venus and Amor and the Arch of Constantine. Named after a statue of Nero, it completed by the Flavian emperors in order to host gladiatorial events.
